page.title: 07Natural History
page.content: This part of the Island is blessed to have one of the mildest climates, facing south east with the coastline on its southern boundary and having rising downland at its back. The whole area is criss crossed with public footpaths, especially along the 'Undercliff'.It is a haven for many forms of wildlife and numbers; red squirrels,foxes,badgers lizards and snakes among them.It also provides a wonderful habitat for the growth of wild flowers.See Appendix 1 for a list of those identified during a short walk along 'Paradise Walk' on Monday the 8th July 1985. The{rare cuckoo-pint (arum neglectum)} has also been found along the undercliff, and the{Glanville {Fritillary}known as the I.O.W. butterfly, a rare species has been spotted in this area.
